description: Two ancient mammoths confront each other, one carrying a diminutive caveman within a fleshy pouch on its trunk. The irony arises from the giant creatures' surprise at the small human's presence, treating him as a mere scent disturbance. This scenario presents an absurd and surreal image of prehistoric life, where hunter becomes an unexpected passenger, noticed only through olfactory means. The scene subverts the typical predator-prey dynamic, highlighting the vast scale difference through a peculiar form of detection.
caption: “Well, what the? ... I thought I smelled something.”
